1.heading: The Robe.
1.title: "Robe of Evil"
1.author: pencils, Vince Alascia ; inks, Mike Sekowsky? and Al Gabrielle
1.appears_in: 24 p. in Captain America Comics, no. 53 (Feb. 1946).
notes: Villain The Robe (Snatch) is introduced and dies; villain named Hammer Riley is introduced; Satan appears in cameo and flashback; introduction of Michael, an angel, in flashback.
Data from Lou Mougin and Tony R. Rose via Grand Comics Database Project.

5.heading: Robed Figures.
5.title: "The Mercenary"
5.author: by Segrelles
5.appears_in: p. 8-11 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 11 (Feb. 1982).
notes: "While trying to rescue the chief's daughter, the Mercenary was taken prisoner. Strange robed figures ordered him to throw down his sword and armor. He was tied up and lowered into a pit. And evidently, he is to stay for quite a long time."

notes: Summary: Lady Balderdash is carrying her husband down the street.

10.title: Roberge, Frank, 1916-1976? "He Told Me to Go Soak My Head"
10.author: Frank Roberge.
notes: Summary: Barf said he wouldn't take orders from Linseed any more, but now he has his head in the sink.

11.title: Roberge, Frank, 1916-1976? "I'm an Artist, Not A Sign Painter!"
11.author: Frank Roberge.
notes: Summary: Mr. Umber decides to paint the sign anyhow, after Mrs. Fitz brings up the subject of back rent.

12.title: Roberge, Frank, 1916-1976? "It Only Happens When I Brush My Teeth"
12.author: Frank Roberge.
notes: Summary: Barf's calling the dentist because his elbow hurts.

13.title: Roberge, Frank, 1916-1976? "Look, Mr. Linseed, My Kite is Flying!"
13.author: Frank Roberge.
notes: Summary: Barf has helped with the kite, and it's stuck in power lines.

14.title: Roberge, Frank, 1916-1976? Mrs. Fitz's Flats : daily syndicate proof sheets
14.author: by Frank Roberge.
notes: Title shortened to Mrs. Fitz beginning in 1961.
Stored remotely. Please request from Special Collections staff at least three days in advance of use.

15.title: Roberge, Frank, 1916-1976? "No Sacrifice Will Be Too Great!"
15.author: Frank Roberge.
notes: Summary: Mr. Umber is going to dedicate his life to his art, but he can't paint a sunrise because he'd have to get up too early.

16.title: Roberge, Frank, 1916-1976? "Please Don't Sing Along while Mr. Keys is Tuning the Piano"

20.title: Roberge, Frank, 1916-1976? "Try Putting Your Weight on Your Left Leg Like This"

21.title: Roberge, Frank, 1916-1976? "What Does Ingenuity Mean, Mrs. Fitz?"
21.author: Frank Roberge.

22.title: Roberge, Frank, 1916-1976? "When He Uses Too Many S's He Throws His Dentures"

notes: Summary: Linseed has been alliterating again.

38.title: "Creepy's Fan Club" p. 64-65 in Creepy, no. 50

39.heading: Roberson, Chris.
39.title: Beyond the Far Stars
39.author: Stan Lee, Chris Roberson, Khary Randolph.
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form as Starborn 1-4."

Summary (from SkyRiver): Unsuccessful writer Benjamin Warner discovers that he is not only not human but the heir to the throne of his native planet, his rejected novels are not fiction but memories of his homeworld, and he is at the center of a galactic war.

40.heading: Roberson, Chris.
40.title: Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep? : Dust to Dust
40.author: written by Chris Roberson ; art, Robert Adler ; colors, Andres Lozano and Javier Suppa ; letters, Jimmy Betancourt.
notes: "This series is the authorized prequel to Do androids dream of electric sheep? by Philip K. Dick."

Summary (from SkyRiver): Who hunted androids before Rick Deckard? Just two men: Malcolm Reed, the only special human with the ability to discern man from machine, and Charlie Victor, who, because of his past, is the perfect man for the job, or is he? Journey through a world returning from the brink of destruction as Malcolm and Charlie hunt down six rogue androids that need to be retired.

41.heading: Roberson, Chris.
41.title: Heir Apparent
41.author: Chris Roberson, writer ; Dennis Culver, artist ; Stephen Downer, colorist ; John J
notes: "Edison Rex continues his efforts to transition from super villain to super hero, in his quest to be the self-appointed defender of Earth. However, the other heroes are not convinced about Rex's change of heart and the other villains are less than pleased with his new career."

42.heading: Roberson, Chris.
42.title: Into the White
42.author: by Chris Roberson ; artist, Dennis Culver ; colorist, Steve Downer ; letterer, John J
notes: Summary (from publisher via SkyRiver): Edison Rex is the smartest man in the world, a criminal genius, and the archnemesis of the world's greatest protector, Valiant. Having dedicated his life to defeating Valiant and proving once and for all that he is a menace to humanity and not a hero, what will Edison do once he finally succeeds? And with Valiant out of the way, who will be left to protect the Earth? This volume collects the first seven issues of the Monkeybrain Comics digital series for the first time.

43.heading: Roberson, Chris.
43.title: Memorial
43.author: written by Chris Roberson ; art by Rich Ellis.

44.heading: Roberson, Chris.
44.title: Memorial
44.author: written by Chris Roberson ; art by Rich Ellis ; colors by Grace Allison ; letters by Neil Uyetake, Robbie Robbins, and Shawn Lee.
notes: "Memorial is the story of Em, a young woman who arrives at a hospital in Portland, Oregon, with no memory of her past. A year later, she has rebuilt her life, only to find her existence thrown into turmoil after she inherits a magical shop. Em is drawn into a supernatural conflict between beings that not only represent but are fundamental elements of the universe itself."

45.title: Roberson, Chris. Memorial : Imaginary Fiends
45.author: written by Chris Roberson ; art by Rich Ellis.

46.heading: Roberson, Chris.
46.title: The New Adventures of Jack and Jack
46.author: writers, Bill Willingham, Matthew Sturges, Chris Roberson ; pencillers, Russ Braun, Tony Akins ; inkers, JosÃ© MarzÃ¡n, Jr
46.appears_in: , et al. ; colorist, Daniel Vozzo ; letterer, Todd Klein.
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form as Jack of Fables, 36-40."

Summary (from SkyRiver): Jack Frost, son of Jack of Fables, has left our world and has decided to make his way to the Imperial Homeworld, where his mother is still trapped under a city of thorns. Along the way he will encounter many fantasy monsters, brigands and troops of roving goblins, and have to battle his way through them. And while Jack Frost undertakes his quest, Jack of Fables is slowly transforming into something unexpected and deadly.

47.heading: Roberson, Chris.
47.title: Repossession
47.author: Chris Roberson, writer ; Michael Allred, art and covers ; J
47.appears_in: Bone, guest artist, "Mix it up" ; Jim Rugg, guest artist, "Monsters of rock" ; Laura Allred, colorist ; Todd Klein, letterer.
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form in iZombie 19-28."

Summary (from SkyRiver): Following the zombie invasion of Eugene, Oregon, the newly-undead Gwen goes underground to elude the troops who have been sent to her town to kill zombies, one of whom is her boyfriend who just found out he has been dating a zombie.

48.heading: Roberson, Chris.
48.title: Star Trek/Legion of Super-Heroes
48.author: written by Chris Roberson ; pencils by Jeffrey Moy ; inks by Philip Moy ; colors by Romulo Fajardo, Jr
48.appears_in: ; letters by Chris Mowry, Shawn Lee, and Robbie Robbins.
notes: "Originally published as Star Trek/Legion of Super-heroes issues #1-6."
Logo of DC Comics on cover.
Summary (from SkyRiver): The crew of the Enterprise and the Legion of Super-heroes must combine forces in order to determine the cause of a new timeline and correct this altered history.

49.heading: Roberson, Dottie--Miscellanea.

notes: Drawn greetings from Bil Keane, Mort Walker, Lynn Johnston, Brad Anderson, Peter Guren, Hank Ketcham, Ron Ferdinand, Patrick McDonnell, Jerry Scott, Rick Kirkman, Ray Billingsley, Dean Young, Rolande Ketcham, Bill Gallo, Bill Canty, Greg Evans, Roger Armstrong, Dick Rockwell, Jim Borgman, Dottie Roberson, John Rivas, Polly Keener, Chance Browne, Mary Anne Case, Jean O'Connell, Cathy Guisewite and Marcus Hamilton.

50.heading: Roberson, Ibraim.
50.title: Justice League : Cry for Justice
50.author: James Robinson, writer ; Mauro Cascioli, Scott Clark, Ibraim Roberson, art ; David Beatty, inks ; Mauro Cascioli, Siya Oum, Giovani Kososki, colorists ; Steve Wands, letterer.
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form in Faces of Evil: Prometheus 1, Justice League: Cry for Justice 1-7, 52, 22, 42."

Summary (from SkyRiver): When Batman and Martian Manhunter are slaughtered by Prometheus, their allies Green Lantern, Green Arrow, Shazam, Supergirl, and Starman team together to defeat him before he can attack again.

51.heading: Roberson, Ibraim.
51.title: Necrosha
51.author: writers, Zeb Wells with Keiron Gillen ; art, Ibraim Roberson, et al
51.appears_in: ; letters, Joe Caramagna with Cory Petit.
notes: "Contains material originally published in magazine form as New Mutants #6-11 and X-Necrosha."
Summary (from SkyRiver): The New Mutants must battle Doug Ramsey, who has returned from the dead and is determined to kill Amara.

52.heading: Roberson, Ibraim.
52.title: Uncanny X-Men : Breaking Point
52.author: written by Kieron Gillen ; illustrated by Carlos Pacheco, Terry Dodson and Ibraim Roberson.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): While Magneto makes a new home for himself off the coast of one the United State's largest cities, a warship from the militaristic alien Breakworld sets a course toward Earth with a mission that will greatly affect the lives of Colossus and Kitty Pryde.

59.heading: Robert.
59.title: Chester 5000 XYV
59.author: by Jess Fink.
notes: "1885: an age of industrial revolution and sexual frustration. Priscilla is a woman with needs, and her inventor husband Robert is a little too busy with his experiments to keep her fully satisfied. Science to the rescue! With a few gears and springs, the proper appendages, a little lubrication, and a lot of love, Chester 5000 is born. He's the perfect tool for the job, but what if Chester is more than just a machine? What are the consequences of trying to engineer love? A delight for adult readers of all stripes, Jess Fink's Top Shelf debut reads like a whimsical love-child of steampunk, silent film and erotic comics."

70.heading: Robert, Alan.
70.title: Crawl To Me : Evil Edgar Edition
70.author: created, written, illustrated & lettered by Alan Robert.
notes: Other title: Alan Robert's Crawl To Me.

"When a young couple moves into an isolated country home during the frigid winter months, they are forced to cope with a series of disturbing events that make them question their relationship, their faith, and their very existence."
"Originally published as Crawl To Me issues #1-4."

71.heading: Robert, Alan.
71.title: Wire Hangers : Under My Skin
71.author: created, written & illustrated by Alan Robert.
notes: Other title: Alan Robert's Wire Hangers.

"When a wave of abductions plagues New York City, no one is safe. It's not a question of if, but of when you'll be taken. The Suicide King Killer is out there, preying on the weak. Will you live in fear, or stand up and fight? Pill-popping detectives, corrupt secret agents, and a mysterious, disfigured homeless man are all inter-connected in this horrific tale of revenge and redemption."

97.title: Robert Bloch's Yours Truly, Jack the Ripper
97.author: story by Robert Bloch ; adapted by Joe R
97.appears_in: Lansdale, John L. Lansdale ; art by Kevin Colden ; lettered by Robbie Robbins.
notes: "World War II-era Chicago is rocked by a series of bloody and gruesome mutilations. No one knows who could be behind such carnage, until a young reporter and a determined detective stumble upon a series of occult clues. Clues that lead straight to the infamous Jack the Ripper! Yet how can the notorious serial killer from Victorian London be stalking the streets of 1940s Chicago? Will our heroes be cunning enough to stop the murders and avoid a deadly fate themselves?"

117.title: "Robert E. Howard's Bloodstar"
117.author: by Richard Corben, John Jakes, and John Pocsik
117.appears_in: p. 5-12 in Heavy Metal, v. 4, no. 11 (Feb. 1981).
notes: "In our last episode, while Bloodstar and his mentor, Grom, were on a hunting trip, they were attacked by wild boars. On his deathbed, Grom told the young Bloodstar of his origin and of his father, who defeated the King of the Northern Abyss."

118.title: "Robert E. Howard's Bloodstar"

120.title: "Robert E. Howard's Bloodstar"
120.author: by Richard Corben, John Jakes and John Pocsik
120.appears_in: p. 12-23 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 3 (June 1981).
notes: "In search of Helva and little Bloodstar, Grom and Bloodstar came upon a group of ravaged Aesirians, apparently killed by the demon that haunts the valley. They set up a trap to lure the sinister serpent Satha, and Bloodstar offered himself as bait, to avenge his former comrades."

121.title: "Robert E. Howard's Bloodstar"
121.author: by Richard Corben, John Jakes, and John Pocsik
121.appears_in: p. 15-24 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 4 (July 1981).
notes: "While on the road, desperately attempting to avenge the death of his wife, Helva, Bloodstar met up with Loknar, Helva's former suitor and his mortal enemy. After a brutal hand-to-hand combat between the two, Bloodstar slew the ex-Aesir war chief, and encountered in the process the horrible demon who haunts the valley."
